greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Irregular triangle T(n,k) for 1 <= k <= (n+1)/2: T(n,k) = number of primitive (aperiodic) palindromic structures of length n using exactly k different symbols.
comment: Permuting the symbols will not change the structure.
reference: M. R. Nester (1999). Mathematical investigations of some plant interaction designs. PhD Thesis. University of Queensland, Brisbane, Australia. [See A056391 for pdf file of Chap. 2]
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..930
formula: T(n, k) = (Sum_{j=0..k} (-1)^j * binomial(k, j) * A284823(n, k-j)) / k!.
T(n, k) = Sum_{d | n} mu(n/d) * stirling2(ceiling(d/2), k).
example: For n=5, structures with 2 symbols are aabaa, ababa and abbba, so T(5,2) = 3.
For n=6, structures with 2 symbols are aabbaa and abbbba, so T(6,2) = 2.
(In this case, the structure abaaba is excluded because it is not primitive.)
mathematica: Table[T[n, k], {n, 1, 15}, {k, 1, Floor[(n+1)/2]}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jun 12 2017, from 2nd formula *)
program: for(n=1, 20, for(k=1, ceil(n/2), print1( a(n,k),", ");); print(););
xref: Partial row sums include A056476, A056477, A056478, A056479, A056480.
results.author: _Andrew Howroyd_, Apr 03 2017
